definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: The young Charlton's greatest strengths were his speed and body swerve.
sentences.chinese: 年轻时查尔顿的看家本领是快速的奔跑和身体变向。

sentences.english: These scenes where the characters actually are running for their lives are terrifying.
sentences.chinese: 这些角色正在为他们的生命奔跑的场景实在可怕。

sentences.english: Crocodiles can move very quickly over short distances on land.
sentences.chinese: 在陆地上，巨鳄可以迅速奔跑一段距离。

sentences.english: Deer can run from the time they are born until they die.
sentences.chinese: 鹿子从出生到死亡都可能奔跑。

sentences.english: For the first time, I felt like I was running into the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次感到自己正在朝着原野方向奔跑。

sentences.english: Try shortening your stride when you run.
sentences.chinese: 试着在奔跑的时候缩短步幅。

sentences.english: A running track should be capable of absorbing the impact of a runner's foot landing on it.
sentences.chinese: 跑道应该能够吸收奔跑者踩踏地面时产生的撞击力。

sentences.english: Melady of running in the wind .
She literally ran along the path toward the gate .
sentences.chinese: 她真的沿着小路向门奔跑过去。

sentences.english: A white lion ran through grass taller than a man.
sentences.chinese: 一头白狮在比人高的草丛中奔跑。

sentences.english: An open flower is love, just the wind blows run it .
sentences.chinese: 花一开就恋爱吧，风一吹就奔跑吧。

sentences.english: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们的脚奔跑行恶，他们急速流人的血。

sentences.english: The best exercise for the Borzoi is free running in a secure area.
sentences.chinese: 最好的运动是在安全区域内自由的奔跑。

sentences.english: Carrie said nothing, and the horse gambolled on.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉没再说话，马在继续奔跑。

sentences.english: A group of officers and men from running, moved to the implementation of the rescue work.
sentences.chinese: 一群官兵奔跑而来，激动地实施抢救工作。

sentences.english: It does not feel good, and it is like running around the playground, circularly, constantly.
sentences.chinese: 这感觉糟糕极了，就像是绕着运动场循环往复地奔跑。

definition: to circle in the air/to soar
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
